column4: I just installed u10.4 and activated the restricted nvidia drivers. When X starts I now have what looks like a horizontal grill across my whole screen, every other line is slightly darker/lighter. can I get rid of the stripes somehow ?
only on boot or all the time?

I only see it in X and it wasn't like this before I activated the restricted drivers. I've got a 120hz tft screen which was detected as 60hz with open drivers, now after turning the restricted drivers on it correctly detects the 120hz.
I did see a larger logo so you might be on to something =)
looking at the page I can't see any indication that it would change the behaviour of X
with X you mean exactly what?
I mean what displayed from the login screen and forward
ok. well that page actually affects only what comes before the login. so it probably doesn't help you.
so you have those orange stripes on the screen all the time?
its not orange, every other horizontal pixel line has a lighter/darker tone
i wonder where i got that orange :) Well, unfortunately i dont have any more ideas as what might be causing your problem. sorry
http://wwww.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1556192 - this person is having the same problem
well, cant say anything but that I'm using the same drivers (geforce go 7300) and it's working fine
it might be the combination with the screen
I suppose you have tried different settings in System->Administration->NVIDIA X Server Settings?
yes, I've changed resolution and refresh rate, doesn't seem to matter which I use the problem is still the same
scanlines does not change in size when I change resolution
